Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the ventilator problem by stating that there were no ventilators left by the previous administration, when in fact there were likely thousands in the Strategic National Stockpile.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there were ventilators in the federal stockpile when Trump took office, as confirmed by a 2017 article and reports of journalists touring the warehouses where ventilators were stored.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or data to back up the assertion that there were no ventilators left by the previous administration.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the ventilator problem was solely caused by not being left ventilators by the previous administration, without considering other factors that could have contributed to the shortage.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the ventilator problem, such as the increasing demand due to the COVID-19 pandemic or delays in acquiring new ventilators by the Trump administration.
